title: Marriage
author: Ferrier, Susan
snippet: Secrecy as to her authorship seems to have been the great desire of herheart, and much of _The Inheritance_ was written in privacy atMorningside House, old Mr. Ferrier's summer retreat near Edinburgh, andshe says, "This house is so small, it is very ill-calculated forconcealment."

title: Marriage
author: Ferrier, Susan
snippet: Secrecy as to her authorship seems to have been the great desire of herheart, and much of _The Inheritance_ was written in privacy atMorningside House, old Mr. Ferrier's summer retreat near Edinburgh, andshe says, "This house is so small, it is very ill-calculated forconcealment."

title: Penelope's Experiences in Scotland; Being Extracts from the Commonplace Book of Penelope Hamilton
author: Wiggin, Kate Douglas Smith
snippet: He wastolerably alert and vigorous, too, although he certainly did not impartelegance to a vehicle, and he knew every street in the court end ofEdinburgh, and every close and wynd in the Old Town. On this our firstmeeting with him, he faltered only when Francesca asked him last of allto drive to 'Kildonan House, Helmsdale'; supposing, not unnaturally,that it was as well known an address as Morningside House, Tipperlinn,whence she had just come. The lamiter had never heard of Kildonan Housenor of Helmsdale, and he had driven in the streets of Auld Reekie forthirty years.

title: Penelope's progress :
author: Wiggin, Kate Douglas Smith
snippet: He was tolerably alert and vigorous, too, although he certainly did not impart elegance to a vehicle, and he knew every street in the court end of Edinburgh, and every close and wynd in the Old Town. On this our first meeting with him, he faltered only when Francesca asked him last of all to drive to " Kildonan House, Helmsdale  ; " supposing, not unnaturally, that it was as well known an address as Morningside House, Tipperlinn, whence she had just come. The lamiter  had never heard of Kildonan House nor of Helmsdale, and he had driven in the streets of Auld Reekie for thirty years.

The lamiter  had never heard of Kildonan House nor of Helmsdale, and he had driven in the streets of Auld Reekie for thirty years.
